What is the largest organ in the human body?
The skin
Which organ filter blood and remove waste as urine?
the kidneys?
Which blood type is the universal donor?
O negative
Functions of red blood cells vs white blood cells?
red: carry oxygen from lungs to the body / white: fight infections and diseases
What is asthma?
airway inflammation that leads to breathing difficulty?
What are the proper terms for sudden illness vs long term recurring ones?
Acute vs Chronic
What is Alzheimer's disease?
A progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting memory
What does MAD stand for in clinical trial?
Mutiple Ascending Doses
What is the use of having placebo in medical research?
To reduce the bias from psychological effect, which triggers natural healing responses that is not medical related
What is "hemorrhage"?
excessive bleeding
Identify FAST, the symptoms of a stroke.
Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency
What is the meaning of PRN in prescriptions?
As needed (latin pro re nata)
Which is safer, xray or MRI?
MRI is safer as it does not use radiation like Xray does.
Difference between ultrasound/Xray?
ultrasound: real time, soft tissue, shows movement / xray: lungs, bones, cheap
What are four things that would make different people react differently to medicine/illness?
age / gender/ race / medical history / family history
What is the recovery position?
Put someone on their side, to keep airway open, prevent choking on vomit
Both common over-the-counter pain relievers, what separates ibuprofen and aspirin?
ibuprofen (brand Nurofen): more fever reduction, safe for kids, lower imflammation / aspirin: for headache, allergic reactions, not for kids
List 5 organs that come in pairs
kidney / lungs / eyes/ ears / ovaries / testes / tonsils / breasts (female)
Ovaries is to woman as what is to man?
Testes!
What is chemo?
Chemotherapy, a treatment for cancer that also kill healthy cells
What does a vaccine do?
Helps the immune system fight infections, by creating a similar but milder attack first
Give three vitals (signs of life).
Blood Pressure, pulse, temperature, respiration rate, oxygen levels
What is the difference between a virus and bacteria?
Virus needs a host to replicate, bacteria are independent organisms.
What is palliative care?
Care focus only on relieving symptoms in serious illnesses.
What is used to listen to heart or lungs?
A stethoscope
What is BMI and how is it calculated?
Body Mass Index shows how muscular a person is, by using weight-to-height ratio. low BMI means less fat.
What is the best way to test for drugs/poison?
Through hair/nail analysis, traces remain for months instead of days in blood/urine
What is heartburn?
Excessive acid from stomach reflux back into the esophagus, causing a burning sensation in the chest
What is the main cause of hiccups?
too much air, sudden shock, eating too fast, or sudden temperature changes (hot/cold drinks)
What is the largest muscle in human body, and what trains it?
Glutes (gluteus maximus, butt muscle), train by doing squats
